means: 风雨剥蚀[损耗]的，饱经风霜的

sentence.Network_en: Not far from the road stood a weatherbeaten old barn of reddish - grey brick and tile.
sentence.Network_cn: 离大路不远,有一个久经风吹雨打的老仓房,由灰中带红的砖和瓦盖的.

entry.tran: (皮肤)经风吹日晒的，饱经风霜的
entry.def: If your face or skin is weather-beaten, it is rough with deep lines because you have spent a lot of time outside in bad weather.

example.ex: ...a stout man with a ruddy, weather-beaten face.
example.tran: 一个强壮的男人，红红的脸上饱经风霜

entry.tran: （物体）饱经风霜的，经风吹日晒的
entry.def: Something that is weather-beaten is rough and slightly damaged after being outside for a long time.

example.ex: They would look out through the cracks of their weather-beaten door.
example.tran: 他们会透过那扇经受风吹日晒的老木门的缝隙向外张望。

auth_sentence.content: Some of the fresh-faced performers lack the weatherbeaten aspect of seasoned seadogs.

auth_sentence.content: He was coming to the end of a month on the ice, and had the weatherbeaten look of someone who has spent too long at sea.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was coming to the end of a month on the ice, and had the weatherbeaten look of someone who has spent too long at sea.
